name: 2-pyridineacetamide
Reason: 2-pyridineacetamide has a melting point that we can compare to pyridine's melting point of 10.5°C (according to the CRC Handbook of Chemistry and Physics, 49th Edition, 1968-1969). The basic unit for our comparison will be pyridine, which has a melting point of 10.5°C. The structural modifications we need to consider are the presence of a pyridine ring and an acetamide group. The pyridine ring introduces additional rigidity and pi-pi interactions, which can raise the melting point by approximately +20°C. The acetamide group introduces a carbonyl functional group, which can participate in hydrogen bonding and increase the melting point by approximately +10°C.
